Scatterer material¶

Built-in material¶

PyMieSim allows you to use the bank of Material to emulate scatterer refracive index which vary as a function of the source wavelength.

To use the Material follow the snippet:

 1from PyMieSim.Scatterer import Sphere
 2from PyMieSim.Source import PlaneWave
 3from PyMieSim import Material
 4
 5Source = PlaneWave(Wavelength   = 450e-9,
 6                  Polarization = 0,
 7                  E0           = 1)
 8
 9Scat = Sphere(Diameter    = 800e-9,
10             Source       = Source,
11             Material     = Material('BK7'))

Generate new material¶

PyMieSim has a toolbox to fetch and load new material data. Using the largest refracitve index bank: refractiveindex.info PyMieSim can directly download and save complex refractive index for a specific material. Doing so the toolbox will save locally the data in the PyMieSim/Data/_Material/data folder and will update the PyMieSim/Meta.json file. Here is what the Meta file look like

 1{
 2    "remote": {
 3        "Aluminium": "https://refractiveindex.info/data_csv.php?datafile=data/main/Al/Rakic.yml",
 4        "BK7": "https://refractiveindex.info/data_csv.php?datafile=data/glass/schott/N-BK7.yml",
 5        "FusedSilica": "https://refractiveindex.info/data_csv.php?datafile=data/main/SiO2/Malitson.yml",
 6        "Silver": "https://refractiveindex.info/data_csv.php?datafile=data/main/Ag/Johnson.yml",
 7        "SodaLimeGlass": "https://refractiveindex.info/data_csv.php?datafile=data/glass/misc/soda-lime/Rubin-clear.yml",
 8        "BorosilicateCrown": "https://refractiveindex.info/data_csv.php?datafile=data/glass/hoya/BSC7.yml",
 9        "Gold": "https://refractiveindex.info/data_csv.php?datafile=data/main/Au/Johnson.yml",
10        "Air": "https://refractiveindex.info/data_csv.php?datafile=data/other/mixed%20gases/air/Ciddor.yml"
11    },
12    "local": {
13        "Aluminium": "Aluminium.npz",
14        "BK7": "BK7.npz",
15        "FusedSilica": "FusedSilica.npz",
16        "Silver": "Silver.npz",
17        "SodaLimeGlass": "SodaLimeGlass.npz",
18        "BorosilicateCrown": "BorosilicateCrown.npz",
19        "Gold": "Gold.npz",
20        "Air": "Air.npz"
21    }
22}

In order to generate new Material to use with PyMieSim one can use the following snippet

 1def run():
 2    from PyMieSim.Data._Material.utils import LoadOnlineSave
 3    from PyMieSim                      import Material
 4
 5    LoadOnlineSave(filename='BK7', url='https://refractiveindex.info/data_csv.php?datafile=data/glass/schott/N-BK7.yml')
 6
 7    Mat = Material('BK7')
 8
 9    Mat.Plot()
10
11
12if __name__ == '__main__':
13    run()

After executing this code a new entry to Meta.json will be added or updated. Afterward the user can use this new material for my computation.

Here is another examples

 1def run():
 2    from PyMieSim.Data._Material.utils import LoadOnlineSave
 3    from PyMieSim                      import Material
 4
 5    LoadOnlineSave(filename='Silver', url='https://refractiveindex.info/data_csv.php?datafile=data/main/Ag/Johnson.yml')
 6
 7    Mat = Material('Silver')
 8
 9    Mat.Plot()
10
11
12if __name__ == '__main__':
13    run()
